columns.mID: A unique identifier for each movie in the database.
columns.title: The title of the movie, representing its name as recognized by audiences.
columns.year: The year in which the movie was released to the public.
columns.director: The name of the individual who directed the movie.

Movie.table_description: The Movie table contains information about various films, including their unique identifiers, titles, release years, and directors. It serves as a foundational reference for movie-related data within the database.

columns.rID: A unique identifier for each reviewer in the database.
columns.name: The full name of the reviewer.

Reviewer.table_description: The Reviewer table stores information about individuals who provide ratings for movies, identified by a unique reviewer ID and their name.

columns.rID: Identifies the reviewer who provided the rating.
columns.mID: Identifies the movie that is being rated.
columns.stars: Represents the rating given to the movie by the reviewer, typically on a scale from 1 to 5 stars.
columns.ratingDate: Indicates the date on which the rating was submitted.

Rating.table_description: The Rating table captures the ratings submitted by reviewers for various movies, providing insights into reviewer preferences and movie quality over a specified time period.
